noun.description: A person employed to provide a service to the public in a particular place.
A person who is present at an event, meeting, or function.
examples: he had become a regular attendant at chapel

adjective.description: Occurring with or as a result of; accompanying.
examples: the sea and its attendant attractions
he warns against the dangers attendant on solitary life

origin: Late Middle English (as an adjective): from Old French, from atendre give one's attention to (see attend).
